pages.text: A companion to the $(l:spells/spell_desaturate)Desaturate$() spell, Saturate instantly converts food items in your inventory into hunger shanks, although gaining less than you would eating them.$(br2)With modifiers, you can increase the amount of shanks you get from food, as well as increase the shanks from specific food types.

pages.title: Spell Configuration
pages.text: $(bold)Cooldown:$() The spell has a cooldown of $(spell:saturate/SECONDS/cooldown) seconds.$(br2)$(bold)Ratio:$() $(spell:saturate/PERCENT/food_multiplier) of the food item is converted into shanks, while $(spell:saturate/PERCENT/saturation_multiplier) of the food item's saturation is converted into saturation.$(br2)With the $(modifier:big_bellied)$() modifier, an additional $(spell:saturate/PERCENT/increased_food_multiplier) of food and $(spell:saturate/PERCENT/increased_saturation_multiplier) of saturation are converted.$(br2)$(bold)Uncooked:$() With the

$(modifier:root_lover)$() modifier, uncooked foods matching the ore dictionary entry $(bold)$(spell:saturate/uncooked_dictionary)$() grant an additional $(spell:saturate/PERCENT/uncooked_food) shanks and $(spell:saturate/PERCENT/uncooked_saturation) saturation.$(br2)$(bold)Cooked:$() With the $(modifier:cooked_goods)$() modifier enabled, cooked foods matching the ore dictionary entry $(bold)$(spell:saturate/cooked_dictionary)$() grant an additional $(spell:saturate/PERCENT/cooked_food) shanks and $(spell:saturate/PERCENT/cooked_saturation) saturation.$(br2)$(bold)Bottled:$() With the $(modifier:bottled_goods)$() modifier enabled, bottle

foods matching the ore dictionary entry $(bold)$(spell:saturate/bottled_dictionary)$() grant an additional $(spell:saturate/PERCENT/bottled_food) shanks and $(spell:saturate/PERCENT/bottled_saturation) saturation.$(br2)$(bold)Resistance:$() With the $(modifier:iron_excess)$() modifier enabled, excess saturation gives you Resistance $(spell:saturate/ROMAN/resistance_amplifier) for $(spell:saturate/SECONDS/resistance_duration) multiplied by the excess saturation.$(br2)$(bold)Poison:$() With the $(modifier:antivenom)$() modifier, poisonous food no longer poisons you, and you gain $(spell:saturate/PERCENT/poison_food) shanks and $(spell:saturate/PERCENT/poison_saturation) saturation.

$(bold)Nausea:$() With the $(modifier:iron_gut)$() modifier enabled, food that cause nausea, hunger, blindness or wither will no longer do so. Those foods will grant $(spell:saturate/PERCENT/nausea_food) additional shanks and $(spell:saturate/PERCENT/nausea_saturation) saturation.$(br2)$(bold)Items:$() With the $(modifier:scattered_goods)$() modifier enabled, item entities that contain food will be consumed within a radius of $(spell:saturate/radius_x) and $(spell:saturate/radius_z) blocks horizontally, and $(spell:saturate/radius_y) vertically.$(br2)$(bold)Inversion:$() With the $(modifier:inversion)$() modifier, foods
with lower saturation and shanks will be converted at a significantly higher ratio, while high-shank and high-saturation foods will be converted at a lower ratio.
